title: Graphic Representation and Computer-Aided Design Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic engineering design concepts, experience with basic CAD software
context.additional_context: A practice-focused course for professionals emphasizing real-world problem-solving. Includes collaborative and creative problem-solving activities using personal devices

learning_goals: Students can apply pre-learned graphic representation theories to real design problems through flipped learning.
Students can systematically analyze complex engineering problems and present visual solutions using the design thinking process.
Students can clearly visualize design concepts and communicate effectively with team members by applying visual thinking techniques.
Students can collaboratively solve real-world industrial design challenges and evaluate final outcomes through problem-based learning (PBL).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
